1.Title: ISCOT 399
1.Author: UNKNOWN
1.Description: A British SIGINT intercept of a COMINTERN message regarding the gassing of Hungarian Jews in Auschwitz

2.Title: Höfle Telegram
2.Author: SS Sturmbahnführer Hermann Höfle
2.Description: A Telegram from Höfle tabulating the total number of deportees to the Aktion Reinhard Camps
2.Attribution: Contains public sector information licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.

4.Title: Bericht zur innen politischen Lager 001
4.Author: UNKNOWN
4.Description: The first in a series of reports from within the RSHA on the internal state of the Third Reich

5.Title: Bericht zur innen politischen Lager 002
5.Author: UNKNOWN
5.Description: The second in a series of reports from within the RSHA on the internal state of the Third Reich

6.Title: Declaration of the causes which impel the state of Texas to secede from the Federal Union : also the ordinance of secession
6.Author: State of Texas
6.Description: Texas' Ordinance of Secession, which effectively severed its ties with the USA from 1861-1865.
6.Source: Library of Congress, Printed Ephemera Collection; Portfolio 346, Folder 43.

7.Title: Abgrenzung der Siedlungsgebiete im ehemals sowjetischen Raum
7.Author: UNKOWN
7.Description: A document describing Himmler's thoughts on prescribing boundaries for German settlement in former Soviet territories.

8.Title: Planungsgrundlagen für den Aufbau der Ostgebiete.- Bericht der Planungshauptabteilung des RKFV
8.Author: UNKOWN
8.Description: A report on the status of Generalplan Ost planning and execution, among other things

9.Title: A Second Jäger Report
9.Author: Karl Jäger
9.Description: A second report from Karl Jäger, updating the figures of murdered civilians given in his first report
9.Source: Wolfram Wette, Karl Jäger. Mörder der litauischen Juden, S. Fischer Verlag, Frankfurt am Main 2011, p. 147

10.Title: A Drafted Memorandum from Winston Churchill Regarding the Dresden Bombing
10.Author: Winston Churchill
10.Description: A draft of a memorandum from Churchill condemning the firebombing of Dresden
10.Source: Joel, Tony, The Dresden Firebombing: Memory and the Politics of Commemorating Destruction, Paperback ed. London, UK: Bloomsbury Academic, 2020, p. 69.

11.Title: A Memorandum from Winston Churchill Regarding the Dresden Bombing
11.Author: Winston Churchill
11.Description: A memorandum from Churchill condemning the firebombing of Dresden
11.Source: Joel, Tony, The Dresden Firebombing: Memory and the Politics of Commemorating Destruction, Paperback ed. London, UK: Bloomsbury Academic, 2020, p. 70.

12.Title: The War Powers Resolution
12.Author: United States Congress
12.Description: The War Powers Resolution passed by the U.S. Congress
12.Source: Joint Resolution of November 7, 1973, Public Law 93-148, 87 STAT 555, Concerning the War Powers of Congress and the President; 11/7/1973; Enrolled Acts and Resolutions of Congress, 1789 - 2011; General Records of the United States Government, Record Group 11; National Archives Building, Washington, DC. [Online Version, https://www.docsteach.org/documents/document/war-powers-resolution, February 13, 2025]

13.Title: Final Report: Japanese Evacuation from the West Coast, Chapters 1 and 2
13.Author: Lieutenant General J.L. De Wit
13.Description: A report on the execution of Japanese Internment. Provides a favorable overview of internment and explains army rationale and logistics. Used as Exhibit B in United States v. Korematsu.
13.Source: "Exhibit B: copy of Final Report: Japanese Evacuation from the West Coast, 1942, Headquarters Western Defense Command and Fourth Army, Office of the Commanding General, Presidio of San Francisco, California; Chapters 1and 2 (Docket filing 39)," 1942. Criminal Case Files, Records of the District Courts of the United States, Record Group 221. San Bruno, CA. NARA.

14.Title: The Militia Act of 1795
14.Author: United States Congress
14.Description: An Act to provide for calling forth the militia to execute the laws of the Union, suppress insurrections, and repel invasions and to repeal the Militia Act of 1792
14.Source: U.S. Laws, Statutes, Etc. An act to provide for calling forth the militia to execute the laws of the Union, suppress insurrections, and repel invasions and to repeal the act now in force for those purposes. Philadelphia, 1795. Pdf. https://www.loc.gov/item/2020769638/.

15.Title: A Draft of Presidential Proclamation 80
15.Author: Abraham Lincoln
15.Description: A draft of Abraham Lincoln's Presidential Proclamation 80, calling up 75,000 militiamen for 3 month's service and calling Congress into an emergency session
15.Source: Lincoln, Abraham. Abraham Lincoln papers: Series 1. General Correspondence. 1833 to 1916: Abraham Lincoln, Monday,Proclamation on State Militia. 1861. Manuscript/Mixed Material. https://www.loc.gov/item/mal0907400/.
15.Attribution: Library of Congress, Manuscript Division, Abraham Lincoln Papers.

16.Title: Presidential Proclamation 80
16.Author: Abraham Lincoln
16.Description: The final version of Abraham Lincoln's Presidential Proclamation 80, calling up 75,000 militiamen for 3 month's service and calling Congress into an emergency session
16.Source: Presidential Proclamation 80 by President Abraham Lincoln Calling for 75,000 Troops. 4/15/1861. NARA. General Records of the United States Government, Record Group 11. [Online Version, https://docsteach.org/documents/document/presidential-proclamation-80-by-president-abraham-lincoln-calling-for-75000-troops, February 14, 2025]

17.Title: John Brown's Last Words
17.Author: John Brown
17.Description: John Brown's last words, as written by him on a slip of paper
17.Source: Villard, Owen Garrison. "John Brown, 1800-1859: A Biography fifty Years After." 1910. Constable, London. p. 554

18.Title: Wannsee Protocol
18.Author: Adolf Eichmann
18.Description: The minutes for the 1942 Wannsee Conference at which the extermination of European Jewry was officially set as state policy
18.Source: Gedenk- und Bildunsstätte Haus der Wannsee-Konferenz

19.Title: Himmler's Speech to the SS-Gruppenführer of October 4th, 1943
19.Author: Heinrich Himmler
19.Description: A full and original transcript of Himmler's speech from October 4th, 1943
19.Source: Harvard Law School Library Nuremberg Trials Project

20.Title: 1942 Letter from Reinhard Heydrich to Martin Luther, which was attached to the minutes of the Wannsee Protocol
20.Author: Reinhard Heydrich
20.Description: A 1942 Letter from Reinhard Heydrich to Martin Luther, which was attached to the minutes of the Wannsee Protocol
20.Source: Gedenk- und Bildunsstätte Haus der Wannsee-Konferenz

21.Title: Long Korherr Report
21.Author: Richard Korherr
21.Description: The long version of Richard Korherr's 1943 report detailing the process of Aktion Reinhard
21.Source: The Holocaust, Selected Documents in Eighteen Volumes, volume 12, p. 224-240 (Document 19)

22.Title: Short Korherr Report
22.Author: Richard Korherr
22.Description: The short version of Korherr's Aktion Reinhard Report, meant for Adolf Hitler himself to read.
22.Source: The Holocaust, Selected Documents in Eighteen Volumes, volume 12, p. 213-219 (Document 18)

23.Title: Cover Letter for the Short Korherr Report
23.Author: Richard Korherr
23.Description: Korherr's cover letter for his short report
23.Source: Poliakov, Léon & Wulf, Josef. Das Dritte Reich und die Juden: Dokumente und Aufsätze. p. 242

24.Title: Himmler's Instructions to Korherr
24.Author: Heinrich Himmler
24.Description: A letter from Himmler to Korherr ordering him to remove all references to 'Sonderbehandlung' (i.e. 'special treatment') from his report.
24.Source: Poliakov, Léon & Wulf, Josef. Das Dritte Reich und die Juden: Dokumente und Aufsätze. p. 241

25.Title: Map of Lithuanian Railroads, circa 1939
25.Author: Office of Strategic Services
Tags: OSS Branch of Research and Analysis
25.Description: A map showing Lithuania's railroads as they were in 1939, as sorted by gauge
25.Source: United States. Office of Strategic Services. Research and Analysis Branch. "Railroads of Lithuania, 1939." Map. Washington, D.C.?: Reproduction Section, OSS, 1943. Norman B. Leventhal Map & Education Center (accessed March 25, 2025).

26.Title: Map of Polish Railroads, circa 1939
26.Description: A map showing Poland's railroads as they were in 1939, as sorted by gauge
26.Source: Mapa Polskich Kolei Państwowych i prywatnych oraz linii samochodowych P. K. P. Bydgoszcz 1939

27.Title: The Mass Extermination of Jews in German Occupied Poland
27.Author: 2nd Polish Republic
27.Description: A pamphlet from the Polish Ministry of Foreign Affairs on the Holocaust
27.Source: Polish Ministry of Foreign Affairs (via Internet Archive)
27.Path: Images/ The Mass Extermination of Jews in German Occupied Poland (1942, Polish government-in-exile) - libgen.li.pdf

28.Title: Interim Policy Changes Regarding Charging, Sentencing, And Immigration Enforcement
28.Author: Emil Bove
28.Description: A memorandum to all DoJ employees rescinding multiple prior DoJ policies pertaining to immigration enforcement and reinstating as interim policy a 2017 memo that orders U.S. Attorney's Offices to pursue “the most serious, readily provable offenses.”
28.Source: FOIA Request to Office of Deputy Attorney General of the United States of America (although, unknown to me, the document was already available on document cloud from the day after its promulgation)
